description.plain:
Wiz Khalifa’s real name is Cameron Jibril Thomaz. Young Khalifa is part of a generation of new rappers, along with Drake, Kid Cudi and others, who came up through internet mixtapes and have little to no connection to the streets, gang violence, or the drug game.

Wiz Khalifa is a Pittsburgh-region rapper famous for his chill flow, weed smoking, and rapid rise to fame. Wiz has released a series of massively successful mixtapes, including Kush & Orange Juice, Star Power, and Cabin Fever, as well as five albums; Rolling Papers, O.N.I.F.C., Blacc Hollywood, KHALIFA, and Rolling Papers 2.

songs.full_title: See You Again by Wiz Khalifa (Ft. Charlie Puth)
songs.title: See You Again

description.plain:
“See You Again” is a tribute to the late Furious actor Paul Walker who died tragically in November of 2013 after his car crashed and burst into flames in Valencia, CA. The first verse is from the perspective of Vin Diesel and the Furious 7 cast members, while the second is from Paul Walker.

Its popularity grew quickly after the release of the film Furious 7, and the music video eventually became the first hip hop song to reach 1 billion YouTube views. It topped the Billboard Hot 100 for twelve weeks, becoming the longest-running rap number one since Eminem’s “Lose Yourself.”

This marks Wiz Khalifa’s second release from the Furious 7 soundtrack, his first being “Go Hard or Go Home” featuring Iggy Azalea.

songs.full_title: Black and Yellow by Wiz Khalifa
songs.title: Black and Yellow

description.plain:
Wiz Khalifa reps the colors of his hometown (Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania) – proudly represented on his car – on this Lemonade-esque production by production team Stargate.

A lot of people know that the city’s sports teams – Steelers, Penguins, and Pirates – all wear black and gold or black and yellow.  But Pittsburgh is so deep into black and yellow, they even have a black and yellow official flag which inspired the colors of the sports teams.

songs.full_title: Medicated by Wiz Khalifa (Ft. Chevy Woods & Juicy J)
songs.title: Medicated

description.plain: “Medicated” is the outro song from Disc 1 of Wiz Khalifa’s fifth studio album “O.N.I.F.C.”; released in 2012. The song features his Taylor Gang Entertainment associates and friends Juicy J & Chevy Woods. A very nice song with a chilled vibe about the artists come-up in comparison with their lifestyles now; and of course with this being a Wiz album, the praise of marijuana and it’s euphoric effects.

description.plain: This song is about people who are so emotionally traumatized by their last relationship that they’re unable to find love with one specific person, so they fix their emotions by having many sexual relations with random people they meet at a party or some other place.

songs.full_title: Bake Sale by Wiz Khalifa (Ft. Travis Scott)
songs.title: Bake Sale

description.plain:
“Bake Sale” gives Wiz and Travis the opportunity to trade verses about their shared love of weed in all of its various forms. Whether smoked, vaporized, or eaten, the duo are down for the high.

The song’s title alludes to the double meaning of “baked” as a slang term for “high,” as well as a method of cooking marijuana edibles.

The song was released as a single on January 21st for the KHALIFA album released on Feb. 5, 2015.

The song was teased for months before being released because it originally faced some copyright problems because the beat already had been used by G-Eazy on “Order More,” but was cleared up when Juicy J, TM88, DJ Spinz, Lex Luger, and Crazy Mike came through with a new beat.

https://twitter.com/wizkhalifa/status/678293821138976768

description.plain:
Wiz drops another snippet from his soon to be released album Blacc Hollywood. The other was “Promises,” but he gave the full release a few hours afterwards, as many wanted to heard the full song. It looks to be a classically song about smoking weed, as that’s Wiz’s favorite part time.

In this song, Wiz samples Ghost Loft’s song “So High,” that why he was credited on the song.

description.plain:
This is a single released off of Wiz Khalifa’s album Blacc Hollywood, which was released on August 19th. Featuring smooth and laid-back production, this track is definitely a break from We Dem Boyz; the track that precedes it on the LP.

This song is written for Amber Rose, who was Wiz’s wife when this released. They have since divorced.

songs.full_title: Paperbond by Wiz Khalifa
songs.title: Paperbond

description.plain:
On “Paperbond,” Wiz Khalifa details his high affinity for a lavish lifestyle, money, designer clothes and his love for the OG kush over chill production by frequent collaborator ID Labs.

“Paperbond” peaked at number 22 on Billboard’s Bubbling Under Hot 100 Singles chart.

The Frank Palladino directed music video was released on June 11, 2013 and has amassed over 76 Million views.

songs.full_title: King of Everything by Wiz Khalifa
songs.title: King of Everything

description.plain:
Wiz Khalifa dropped this cold banger unexpectedly on September 28, 2015, on SoundCloud. Seconds before releasing the track, the rapper tweeted the single artwork, hinting the release of this track. The production is handled by Cozmo and Pittsburgh based team ID Labs.

This may appear on his upcoming album and major label debut sequel, Rolling Papers 2: The Weed Album.



Fun fact: A couple months before the release of this track, Wiz uploaded a video on his personal Instagram, showing him listening to it in his car.
https://instagram.com/p/3M8NeHHds6/?taken-by=mistercap

songs.full_title: Roll Up by Wiz Khalifa
songs.title: Roll Up

description.plain:
Roll Up.
It’s Rolling Papers!
This song is about Wiz letting all the women know that if they ever need him, he’ll be a call away.

If you notice, Wiz is using the term “Roll Up” for both weed and his girl(if you read in between the lines)
However, It could be him comparing weed/marijuana to a woman (A.K.A Mary Jane). It wouldn’t be nothing new for Wiz to show his immense love for weed.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wSfK3lW5-Lk

All I Need Is Mary (Mary Mary)

body.plain: “Blacc Hollywood” is Wiz Khalifa’s first album which made it to the top spot of the Billboard 200. To celebrate this big success, Wiz ’s wife, Amber Rose, decided to post a short video on instagram, twerking to this song.

songs.full_title: Never Been by Wiz Khalifa
songs.title: Never Been

description.plain:
Nerds and old-school gamers rejoice! A major standout track from Kush & OJ (if not the mixtape’s most popular song overall) Wiz and his producers sampled a song from a Super Nintendo game (“Schala’s Theme” from Chrono Trigger, to be specific) for this track, off the Kush and Orange Juice mixtape.

This isn’t the first time he’s rapped over a video game beat, either: see “One Way” off Burn After Rolling, which samples a song from an NES Kirby game.

description.plain:
Wiz dropped this with its music video out of the blue on May 5th 2015. The song is definitely more reminiscent of the “Say Yeah” era Wiz rather than his new Trap Wiz sound.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lmxcp_i9T3s

The song samples Minnie Riperton’s song titled “Completeness”.
